title: Taylor Swift reveals favorite song while playing game on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon
text:
Taylor Swift revealed that her favourite song is Nelly's classic 2002 hit Hot in Herre during a hilarious game on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.

The Shake It Off hitmaker, 29, went head-to-head against host Jimmy, 45, in a challenge called Name That Song.

And when house band The Roots played the opening chords of the 2002 hit, an excited Taylor got the song immediately as she declared: 'It's Nelly, it's Nelly, it's Nelly's Hot in Herre! This is my favourite song.'

Scroll down for video

Fun: Taylor Swift revealed that her favourite song is Nelly's classic 2002 hit Hot in Herre during a hilarious game on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon

Taylor then went on to show off her impressive dance skills as she started shimmying to the Nelly track and joked: 'Middle school imprints on you!'

The star went on to guess several more of the tracks, including Kiss Me by Sixpence None the Richer, which she revealed was the first guitar song she learnt to play.

Yet when The Roots started playing her own song, Shake It Off, it was Jimmy who guessed it first as a red-faced Taylor jokingly pretended to storm off stage.

Hot in Herre: The Shake It Off hitmaker, 29, went head-to-head against host Jimmy, 45, in a challenge called Name That Song

Game time: And when house band The Roots played the opening chords of the 2002 hit, an excited Taylor got the song immediately as she declared: 'It's Nelly, it's Nelly, it's Nelly's Hot in Herre! This is my favourite song.'

Taylor received a standing ovation when she later stepped out for her interview.

She was promoting her upcoming appearance as musical guest this weekend on Saturday Night Live.

Yet this wasn't the only funny moment of the show as Jimmy went on to share a hilarious surprise video of the singer after her recent LASIK eye surgery, sneakily captured by her mother Andrea Swift.

'That's on television?' the Lover singer asked in shock after the video rolled.

Quick answer: Taylor then went on to show off her impressive dance skills as she started shimmying to the Nelly track and joked: 'Middle school imprints on you!'

Swift after surgery: Yet this wasn't the only funny moment of the show as Jimmy went on to share a hilarious surprise video of the singer after her recent LASIK eye surgery, sneakily captured by her mother Andrea Swift

In the clip, a drugged up Swift can be seen fumbling with a bunch of bananas while wearing a brown sweater and a protective plastic shield over her eyes.

The ME! singer rips one of the yellow fruits off it's stem, but it's not the one she was aiming for, she complains: 'The wasn't the one I wanted!'.

Taylor's mother then helps her rip off the 'right' banana and then she puzzles: 'What do we do with this one now?', with mama Swift replying: 'I'll eat it. I'll eat it. It's mine.'

Going bananas: In the clip, a drugged up Swift can be seen fumbling with a bunch of bananas while wearing a brown sweater and a protective plastic shield over her eyes

Wide awake! Banana in hand, Swift is escorted back to her bed, 'don't fall asleep eating your banana, ok?' her mother warns, to which Taylor responds: 'I'm not asleep. My mind is alive!'

Surprise! Taylor was left gobsmacked over the footage after it finished with Jimmy pleading: 'Don't be mad at me. I may have made some calls!'

Yet the singer is still upset as she whines: 'But it doesn't have a head!'

Banana in hand, Swift is then escorted back to her bed so she can get some rest, yet later she can be seen in her bed comically munching on her treat.

'Don't fall asleep eating your banana, ok?' her mother warns, to which Taylor hilariously responds: 'I'm not asleep. My mind is alive!'

Taylor was left gobsmacked over the footage after it finished with Jimmy pleading: 'Don't be mad at me. I may have made some calls!'

Talented: She was promoting her upcoming appearance as musical guest this weekend on Saturday Night Live

Musical guest: Taylor also spoke about her upcoming Lover Fest tour in the summer of 2020 in support of her new hit album Lover

Taylor also spoke about her upcoming Lover Fest tour in the summer of 2020 in support of her new hit album Lover.

She has seven shows planned in Europe, one in Brazil and two shows at SoFi Stadium in Los Angeles as part of the Lover Fest West and two shows at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Massachusetts as part of Lover Fest East.

'Basically, I just kind of felt like this album, I was going to try something new. I haven't done festivals in a really long time and I just saw this album as like, a really festival-y album,' Taylor said.

Lover tour: She has seven shows planned in Europe, one in Brazil and two shows at SoFi Stadium in Los Angeles as part of the Lover Fest West and two shows at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Massachusetts as part of Lover Fest East

She added that she also wanted the opportunity 'to open a stadium in L.A., which is really exciting'.

It was announced last month that Taylor's concerts on July 25 and July 26 will be the grand opening event to open the SoFi Stadium located at the former site of the Hollywood Park Racetrack in Inglewood, California.

The stadium will serve as the home to the Los Angeles Rams and Los Angeles Chargers of the National Football League.
description: The Shake It Off hitmaker, 29, went head-to-head against host Jimmy, 45, in a challenge called Name That Song.
